title: Karur stampede: SC reserves order on TVK's plea challenging HC order to set up SIT
content: The plea has objected to the high court constituting a special investigation team (SIT) only with officers of the Tamil Nadu Police

title: People obsessed with loan waiver, says Maharashtra Minister; admits politicians give promises for poll win
content: His remarks drew flak from various quarters, including the ruling allies, with BJP leader and Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule saying nobody should make statements on the loan waiver issue as farmers were facing serious financial distress in the wake of heavy rains and floods in parts of the State.

title: Nainar Nagenthran slams DMK govt. for not implementing monthly billing cycle for electricity tariff
content: In a post on X, Mr. Nagenthran said the DMK, while in the Opposition, had opposed any increase in electricity tariff. However, after coming to power, it had raised the tariff several times

title: How Assam’s cotton is getting a contemporary spin
content: Assam-based designer Anushka Das is redefining the state’s textile narrative by turning its traditionally heavy cotton into a finer, fluid fabric

title: Union govt. should set up Centre of Excellence for AI in Tamil Nadu: IT Minister
content: Speaking at the Global Startup Summit, Palanivel Thiaga Rajan said Tamil Nadu wants to adopt AI to improve the functioning of the government

title: Gadkari promises completion of NH-66 reaches in Kerala in December
content: Work on the Palakkad-Kozhikode greenfield highway and Thiruvananthapuram Outer Ring Road will begin in January, Union Minister tells Kerala Chief Minister

title: Armstrong case: Madras High Court orders retired govt. doctor to be included in team conducting autopsy on Nagendran’s body
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar, however, rejects a plea made by the wife of the deceased to include a doctor of her choice in the team

title: Kerala CM tells Centre its fiscal policies imperil State’s development and social progress
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says Kerala has apprised Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman that the Centre’s fiscal policies threatened to imperil the State’s development and hobble its expansive social security net

title: ‘Kitchen Mogul’ T.T. Jagannathan of T.T.K. Prestige passes away at 77
content: Mr. Jagannathan was instrumental in turning around the T.T.K. Group and making it debt-free, which he described as being achieved through “a huge dose of common sense.”

title: Andhra spurious liquor racket: YSRCP MP Midhun Reddy urges CBI probe
content: “The poorest sections of society are the worst affected, as they are deceived by counterfeit bottles branded as reputed labels,” says Midhun Reddy

title: Kerala CM seeks PM Modi’s intervention to safeguard State’s finances and drive development
content: After meeting Modi in Delhi, Pinarayi Vijayan says Kerala and Centre will remain in ‘a constant mode of productive engagement’ for national development and public welfare

title: Seating capacity at Kaloor stadium for Argentina football match to be decided after safety audit; experts from IIT Palakkad in Kochi
content: Greater Cochin Development Authority has handed over the stadium to Sports Kerala Foundation to facilitate infrastructural enhancements in association with sponsors of the event ahead of Argentina team’s visit in November

title: SC reserves order on pleas for nod to manufacture, sell green firecrackers in Delhi-NCR
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for NCR States, told a Bench of Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justice K. Vinod Chandran that on Deepavali, bursting of green crackers be permitted from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m.

title: Actor Suniel Shetty moves High Court against misuse of his photos on social media
content: The actor, in the plea, claimed that he had a right over his personality and photos, and passing them off without authority was damaging his reputation

title: CPCB reiterates recommendation to fix 150-m safety distance between stone quarries, houses in Kerala
content: The CPCB seeks to reiterate the findings and recommendations of the joint committee in its report filed on March 3, 2023, said a reply dated September 20, 2025 filed by the central board before the Principal Bench of the tribunal

title: PM Modi calls for making conversations on mental health more mainstream
content: The World Mental Health Day serves as a powerful reminder that mental health is a fundamental part of our overall well-being, the PM wrote on X

title: Centre to approve elite marine operations battalion for Kerala, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan after meeting Amit Shah
content: Pinarayi says Amit Shah conveyed that Centre will bear a significant part of the cost of raising the battalion, including training, weapon procurement, and imparting operational readiness

title: Odisha social activist Ranjeeta Priyadarshini had proposed menstrual leave for working women: Santosh Lad
content: The Labour Minister said the Karnataka government’s unanimous decision to give a 12-day paid menstrual leave a year would greatly benefit women working in garment and other small industries.

title: India to upgrade ‘technical mission’ in Kabul to the status of Embassy: Jaishankar
content: India had closed its Embassy in Kabul after the Taliban seized power following the withdrawal of U.S.-led NATO forces in 2021, but opened a technical mission a year later

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea seeking guidelines on suspension, blocking of social media accounts
content: The apex court allowed the two petitioners to withdraw the plea and told them that they were free to seek any other remedy available in law before an appropriate forum

title: Bengaluru rains: ORR, Electronics City sink; city traffic paralysed by monsoon misery
content: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), rainfall recorded on October 9 evening was 5.1 mm at HAL Airport, 3.6 mm at Kempegowda International Airport, and 9.5 mm at the KSNDMC campus.

title: Supreme Court gives Centre four weeks to respond to pleas on restoration of J&K Statehood
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the Centre, said consultations were underway with the Jammu and Kashmir administration regarding the restoration of Statehood.

title: NCSC seeks report on ‘caste bias’ allegations following Haryana IPS officer’s death
content: The Commission, in the notice issued on Thursday (October 9, 2025), said that it had taken suo motu cognizance of media reports about the suicide note and had decided to investigate the issue

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea on cough syrup deaths
content: The petitioner said ‘precious time’ was passing without any substantial steps taken in the investigation by the States

title: Kerala Tourism marks John Lennon’s 85th birthday with ‘Imagine’-inspired post celebrating peace
content: A picture featuring five women artistes clad in the traditional attire of three religious art forms and crossing a road with the tagline ‘Imagine/ all the people/ livin’ life in peace’ reminds netizens of John Lennon’s message about peace

title: Villupuram MP urges Union Finance Minister to continue GST concession on car purchases for persons with disabilities
content: In a letter to Nirmala Sitharaman, the MP said persons with disabilities were earlier provided 10% GST concession on the purchase of cars, paying only 18% GST, instead of the standard rate. However, following the recent revision in GST slabs, all small cars are now uniformly taxed at 18%

title: Bengal Job scam allegations: ED conducts search operations at six locations in Kolkata
content: The ED raids include Minister Sujit Bose’s residence-cum-office in Salt Lake, and the houses of former officials of the Dum Dum Municipality

title: U.S. Ambassador to India Sergio Gor in Delhi to hold bilateral discussions
content: Sergio Gor and U.S. Deputy Secretary for Management and Resources Michael J. Rigas are meeting their counterparts to discuss bilateral issues

title: Zubeen Garg's personal security officers arrested in singer's death case
content: Nandeswar Bora and Paresh Baishya, deputed by the government as part of Garg's security detail, were suspended by the Assam Police on Tuesday (October 7) after multiple rounds of questioning

title: India notifies first emission intensity targets for carbon-intensive sectors
content: According to the notification, each facility must reduce the amount of greenhouse gases emitted per unit of output compared to a 2023-24 baseline.

title: Trump has claimed that he stopped Operation Sindoor using trade 50 times now: Congress
content: He did not, of course, forget to speak to the man who had unleashed the genocide on Gaza - the Israeli PM Benjamin  Netanyahu - also during this time, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Kerala MLA U. Prathibha’s remark on inviting ‘scantily clad’ stars for inaugurations sparks row
content: Speaking at an event, Kayamkulam MLA said ‘when an actor comes without wearing proper clothes, people flock to that programme in large numbers. We should tell them to stop that’

title: Poll code violation case against Pappu Yadav for distributing money among flood victims in Vaishali
content: The case was registered against Mr. Yadav, the Independent MP from Purnea, at the Sahdei police station on Thursday (October 9, 2025) night on the basis of a complaint filed by the district administration

title: AI-powered alerts systems saved over five lakh lives during 2024 Kerala floods, said MoS Communications
content: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) uses the Cell Broadcast System (CBS) to send emergency alerts during disasters like floods, cyclones, or earthquakes.

title: Police told to take strict action against lawbreakers: Ajit Pawar on row over gangster Ghaywal
content: I have given clear instructions to the Pune Police Commissioner to take the strongest action against those who try to violate the rules and take the law into their own hands, says Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar

title: Conrad Sangma's NPP played role in destroying Manipur's stability, alleges Congress
content: Since 2017, the BJP and its ally NPP have played a major role in destroying the stability and spirit of the State — truly, BJP and NPP are two faces of the same coin, says Manipur Congress president Keisham Meghachandra

title: Karur stampede hearing updates: SC reserves order on plea filed by TVK, others challenging HC order to set up SIT
content: TVK has urged that a ‘pre-planned conspiracy by certain miscreants to create trouble at the site of the rally cannot be ruled out.’

title: Fight to protect Chelam Hill gets stronger in northern Andhra Pradesh
content: APGENCO’s proposed 3,200 MW supercritical coal-based thermal power project in the hill range is facing strong opposition from the forest-dependent Savara and Jatapu tribal communities. T. Appala Naidu explores the dynamics at one of the most fertile regions in northern Andhra Pradesh, where local tribal communities are preparing to fight against environmental disruption they fear will be caused by the project

title: SIM-phony of scams: ordinary homes, extraordinary crimes in Hyderabad
content: Behind the hum of kitchens, chatter of tea stalls and the calm of ordinary streets, tiny SIM boxes blink in silent rhythm, channeling international calls and powering ‘digital arrest’ scams that drain crores from victims across India. Lavpreet Kaur peels back the curtain on how lax telecom checks, fragile banking systems and clever criminal networks transform everyday spaces into nerve centres of high-tech deception

title: BJP workers clash with police in Palakkad over Sabarimala gold-plating row
content: BJP State vice-president B. Gopalakrishnan and Palakkad east district president Prasanth Sivan led the march; Mahila Morcha workers too joined the protest by raising Ayyappa slogans.

title: Vizag Junior Lit Fest 2025: Registrations open for two days of stories and fun for young readers
content: Vizag Junior Lit Fest, a two-day celebration of stories, creativity and conversations, to be held in November with registrations for sessions opening on October 11

title: Karur police detain Salem district secretary of TVK
content: A case was registered against TVK workers for allegedly assaulting a private ambulance driver during the Karur stampede

title: Jagan demands a rollback on move to ‘privatise’ medical colleges in Andhra Pradesh
content: The YSRCP chief accuses Naidu of halting the works at ten medical colleges by issuing a stop memo in September 2024

title: Bihar Assembly Election LIVE: Filing of nomination papers for first phase begins
content: Candidates can file their nomination papers till October 17, and the scrutiny of such documents will be held on the next day, according to a notification.

title: Official crime data does not reflect women’s ordeal in Manipur 2023 conflict
content: Data show a spike in criminal activity in the State in 2023, but a drop in reported crimes against women during the conflict

title: Buffering Karnataka’s waterbodies
content: In the recently concluded monsoon session, the Karnataka government introduced the Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which amends the 2014 Act to define graded buffer zones around tanks based on their size. While there is no universally accepted definition of buffer zones, in many countries they are designated areas around waterbodies intended to minimise the negative impacts of human settlements, The Hindu reports.

title: Coldrif cough syrup banned in Bengal after child deaths linked to it in Madhya Pradesh
content: "The batch linked to the Madhya Pradesh incident has not entered West Bengal, but as a precautionary measure, we have informed all sellers to stop its sale," BCDA secretary Prithwi Basu said.

title: Haryana IPS officer’s death case: Wife IAS officer flags irregularities in FIR
content: In a letter to Chandigarh Police SSP Kanwardeep Kaur, Amneet P Kumar, a senior IAS officer, sought that “diluted sections of the SC/ST Act” that have been added in the FIR should be amended.

title: Remembering C. Minakshi, a trailblazing scholar and authority on Pallava history
content: She was the first woman to receive a doctorate from the University of Madras in 1936. In four years as a professional historian, she published over 30 articles and four books. In 1939, the ASI asked her to study the sculptures at the Vaikuntaperumal Temple in Kancheepuram. This work remains an authoritative reference on Pallava art

title: Natarajasundaram Pillai, the nagaswaram player who excelled in complex rhythms
content:
Pallavi Natarajasundaram Pillai, as he was known, was renowned for mallaris. The available recordings are an invaluable documentation of his style and a testimony to his astonishing grip on layam or thalam. There would be no dull moment in a concert by Natarajasundaram Pillai, says thavil  maestro 
Haridwaramangalam A.K. Palanivel

title: When Justice Party contemplated admitting Brahmins into its fold nearly 100 years ago
content: B. Munuswami Nayudu, the Chief Minister of Madras Presidency during 1930-32, tried in vain to admit ‘willing’ Brahmins to the party. At the party’s Nellore confederation in October 1929, he sought to amend the by-laws because the exclusion of one community had resulted in the party not being a ‘full representative’ of the Presidency

title: Interview | Author and Rajya Sabha MP Salma on juggling writing and politics
content: A new translation of Salma’s first novel, The Dark Hours of the Night, foregrounds the voices of marginalised women

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) demands to sack Mahayuti Minister over granting weapon licence to criminal’s brother
content: Yogesh Kadam allegedly overruled a police report to grant a gun licence to Sachin Ghaywal, the brother of notorious Pune gangster Nilesh Ghaywal

title: Bhupendra Patel outlines roadmap for ‘Viksit Gujarat, Viksit Bharat’

title: Giants turn tables on Eagles with complete home victory

title: Sister Jean, beloved Loyola-Chicago chaplain, dies
content: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the longtime chaplain of the Loyola-Chicago men's basketball team, died Thursday at the age of 106. "[She] was an invaluable source of wisdom and grace for generations of students, faculty, and staff," the school said.

title: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
content: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.

title: Dart, Giants hope win over Eagles shifts narrative
content: Jaxson Dart led the Giants to a convincing 34-17 win over the Eagles on Thursday night, a victory that they hope begins to change the perception of the team, which went 3-14 last season.

title: Boyd, Happ atone for struggles as Cubs force G5
content: The Cubs got a lift from two struggling players Thursday night, as starter Matthew Boyd and left fielder Ian Happ helped set the tone in a 6-0 Game 4 victory over the Brewers.

content: Eagles right tackle Lane Johnson said the offense needs to work hard to "keep defenses guessing" after Thursday night's 34-17 loss to the Giants.

title: Who Is Maria Corina Machado, Nobel Peace Prize Winner 2025
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her "tireless work promoting democratic rights" and a peaceful transition from dictatorship in the country.

title: Maria Corina Machado Awarded Nobel Peace Prize 2025
content: Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her work in promoting democracy and fighting dictatorship in her country.

title: No Nobel Or Peace For Trump Despite Relentless Campaign
content: It's a distressful day for Donald Trump. After months of the US President claiming to be the most deserving contender for the Nobel Peace Prize, the Norwegian Nobel Committee has announced a "brave woman" as this year's winner.

title: How Much Prize Money Does A Nobel Peace Laureate Get?
content: With the results of the Nobel Peace Prize 2025 being announced on Friday, many are curious not just about the laureates, but also about the prize money that comes with one of the world's most prestigious awards.

title: Actor Pawan Singh's Wife Meets Prashant Kishor Ahead Of Bihar Elections

title: Video: Students Take Shelter Under Chairs As Earthquake Hits Philippines
content: A powerful 7.5 magnitude earthquake shook the southern coast of the Philippines on Friday morning. A video from what appears to be a university class has emerged, showing the moment the earthquake hit Davao City.

title: 2 Dead As 7.4 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Philippines, Tsunami Warnings Lifted
content: The earthquake, in waters off the town of Manay in the province of Davao Oriental, triggered a tsunami alert for coasts within 300 km of the epicentre.

content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), a multinational IT services provider, on Friday announced the launch of an Artificial Intelligence (AI) experience zone and design studio in London, reaffirming its continued strategic investment across the UK.

title: Four migrant workers injured in cooking gas explosion in Kerala’s Kannur; two critical
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . migrant workers sustained burns in an explosion reportedly following cooking gas cylinder leak at their rented quarter near Pudiyanga . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health .

title: Nobel snub: Donald Trump misses out on Peace Prize - why he lost
content: Venezuelan pro-democracy leader Maria Corina Machado has been awarded the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her unwavering fight against Nicolás Maduro's regime and her advocacy for free elections. The committee's decision, made prior to any recent geopolitical events, firmly excludes US President Donald Trump, who had expressed expectations for the award. Machado's courage in the face of persecution inspires millions.

title: Watch: Patna metro station filled with gutka stains in 3 days
content: Barely days after its inauguration, Patna Metro stations are already marred by red gutka stains. A viral video highlights the widespread vandalism, with walls, stairs, and platforms defaced. A frustrated citizen expressed dismay at the public's disregard for the new infrastructure, questioning civic sense.

title: Microsoft engineer quits: emails thousands of staff; says can't enable war
content: A principal software engineer at Microsoft resigned, citing the company's cloud services contracts with the Israeli military. This follows protests and the termination of five employees over similar concerns. While Microsoft cut some services to an Israeli intelligence unit, activists argue it's insufficient, demanding a complete halt to military contracts.

title: 'I tried committing suicide': Cricketer reveals gory details - Watch
content: Tazmin Brits has made an extraordinary comeback to cricket after a serious car accident. Her determination and a chance encounter with a provincial coach paved her way back. Brits' brilliant century against New Zealand in the World Cup solidified her as a key player, showcasing her resilience and ability to perform under pressure.

title: In Sabarimala gold theft, a Vijay Mallya connection
content: Pandalam Palace representatives are demanding a thorough investigation into how gold sheets, gifted by Vijay Mallya in 1998 for the Sabarimala Dwarapalaka idol, allegedly turned non-gold by 2019. They question the capability of repair sponsors and the negligence in procedures, urging accountability for those involved in the temple's upkeep.

title: China-US tensions: Beijing hits US ships with ‘special port fees’
content: China will implement "special port fees" on US-built or operated ships starting October 14, with charges of 400 yuan per net tonne. This retaliatory measure mirrors US port fees imposed on Chinese vessels, aiming to protect Chinese shipping companies' interests. Beijing urges Washington to reverse its actions.

title: Zoho founder: Indians' success in US no conspiracy; calls it a success of visa system
content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explains why Indian professionals dominate American technology leadership, attributing it to unintended consequences of the H-1B visa and green card system. The lengthy immigration process made job switching risky, creating committed long-term employees who naturally earned promotions. Vembu emphasises R&D success requires time-intensive commitment, not just funding. His comments come amid controversy over Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B fee.

title: Son of Pulwama martyr, Rahul selected for Haryana U19; Sehwag: 'It has been my privilege'
content: Rahul Soreng, whose father died in the Pulwama attack, has been selected for the Haryana Under-19 cricket team. Former Indian opener Virender Sehwag congratulated Rahul. Sehwag International School provides free education and boarding for children of martyrs. Rahul has been studying at the school since 2019. This selection marks a significant achievement for Rahul and his family.

title: 'Committed to sovereignty': Jaishankar meets Afghan FM; India to reopen embassy in Kabul
content: India is upgrading its Technical Mission in Kabul to an embassy, signaling a renewed commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty and regional stability. External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted cooperation in mining and trade, while Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi pledged not to allow Afghan territory for anti-India activities, emphasising mutual respect and people-to-people ties.

title: Netflix TV screens gaming: 5 games unveiled; step-by-step guide
content: Netflix has launched mobile games on smart TVs, allowing subscribers to play directly on their screens using smartphones as controllers. This move signifies a major commitment to interactive entertainment, expanding beyond traditional streaming to offer social and family-friendly gaming experiences. The company aims to enhance subscriber engagement and retention through this new feature.

title: 'Traffic means growth': Priyank Kharge's bizarre justification for Bengaluru jams
content: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge views Bengaluru's traffic congestion as a positive indicator of economic growth, attributing it to the city's booming job market and influx of migrants. He highlighted significant office space absorption and a large vehicle count, suggesting these are symptoms of a thriving economy that needs to be managed.

title: Where women want to work in India: AP, Kerala Gujarat lead; top 10 list here
content: The India Skills Report 2025 by Wheebox reveals the top 10 Indian states where women prefer to work, highlighting growing employability trends and regional preferences. Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, and Maharashtra lead the list. The report underscores how safety, infrastructure, and career opportunities shape women’s workplace choices and guide employers’ diversity strategies.

title: Bihar polls: 17 EBC, 11 OBC, 9 general, 7 Muslims in Jan Suraaj's 1st list
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party unveiled its first 51 candidates for Bihar polls, prioritizing individuals from non-political backgrounds. The list features doctors, academics, retired officers, a singer, and Karpoori Thakur's granddaughter, aiming to offer a fresh alternative. Caste equations were considered, with representation from EBC, OBC, general, and Muslim communities, alongside women and a transgender candidate.

title: Did Raja Jackson plead guilty to assault charges? UFC legend’s son faces jail time
content: Raja Jackson, son of UFC legend Rampage Jackson, has pleaded not guilty to felony battery charges following a violent assault on pro-wrestler Syko Stu. The incident, which occurred at an independent wrestling event, resulted in Stu sustaining serious injuries. Jackson faces potential imprisonment, with a preliminary hearing scheduled.

title: Trump seeks fair play! US asks China to not fly over Russia
content: The US government has proposed barring Chinese airlines from flying over Russia on routes to and from the United States, citing unfair competitive advantages. This move aims to level the playing field for American carriers, which lost access to Russian airspace after the Ukraine invasion. The proposal could impact major Chinese airlines and adds to existing US-China economic tensions.

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal scripts history, joins elite list of cricket legends
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's magnificent century dominated the opening day against the West Indies, propelling India to a commanding position. His seventh Test hundred before 24 places him among cricketing legends. Jaiswal's consistent opening prowess outshines all others since his debut, solidifying his status as a rising star.

title: Cough syrup deaths: SC rejects PIL seeking CBI probe, drug safety review; toll at 21 in MP
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea for a CBI investigation into the deaths of children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. These deaths were reportedly caused by a toxic cough syrup. The manufacturer's owner has been arrested. Several states have banned the syrup, and the factory has been sealed.

title: Noida horror: Man kills dhaba worker who refused to pack late-night food order
content: A dhaba worker was beaten to death in Gaur City-2 after a dispute over late-night food orders. Police have arrested one of the main accused, Kaushal Mishra, following a tip-off. The incident occurred when the trio, allegedly drunk, argued with staff after being refused service. Efforts are underway to apprehend the third accomplice.

title: Bengaluru pub: Bank manager found dead inside ladies' washroom
content: A 31-year-old bank manager was found dead in a pub's ladies' washroom in Bengaluru under suspicious circumstances. Megharaj, who had consumed alcohol and food with friends, reportedly felt unwell and entered the washroom before being discovered unconscious. The cause of death is pending post-mortem and forensic analysis.

title: UP murder: Ex-boyfriend slits woman's throat; arrested after encounter
content: Kaushambi police have arrested Balbeer Singh Patel for the murder of a woman in Sirathu, whose throat was slit. Singh, the victim's former lover, was apprehended after an encounter where he fired at police and was shot in the leg. The murder weapon, a motorcycle, and the victim's phone were recovered.

title: Ex-cricketer tears into selectors for snubbing Samson from ODIs - Watch
content: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized the selection committee for overlooking Sanju Samson in favor of Dhruv Jurel for the Australia ODI series. Kaif argued Samson's consistent middle-order performance and prowess against spin make him a better fit for Australian conditions, questioning the focus on recent form over sustained ability.

title: ‘Speak Kannada’: Woman accuses Bengaluru Uber driver of abusing her
content: A woman in Bengaluru alleged an Uber auto driver abused her and attempted to hit her, claiming the driver demanded she speak Kannada and took videos during the confrontation. The incident occurred after she cancelled a ride, with the driver later blocking her path and demanding money, stating she was being targeted due to her Northeast origin.

title: Almost 14 foot: Largest great white shark recorded in Atlantic resurfaces - Video
content: A colossal 14-foot male great white shark, named Contender, has journeyed from Florida to the northern Gulf of St. Lawrence. This 1,653-pound giant, the largest male tagged by OCEARCH in the western North Atlantic, is likely drawn by abundant seal and fish populations. Researchers are tracking its extensive migration patterns.

title: Hit by EU sanctions over Russia oil - India's Nayara struggles to sustain
content: Nayara Energy, a major Indian refinery with significant Russian ownership, is navigating EU sanctions by boosting domestic fuel distribution via increased rail transport. The company, now solely sourcing crude from Russia, faces challenges securing export markets and processing international payments.

title: India’s most employable graduates in 2025: MBAs first; engineers a close second
content: According to the India Skills Report 2025 by Wheebox, MBA graduates are India’s most employable at 78%, followed by B.Tech (71.5%) and MCA (71%). The national employability rate stands at 54.81%, with rising demand for business, technology, and IT expertise. The report highlights upskilling, adaptability, and a blend of technical and human skills as key to job readiness.

title: IPL 2026 auction: Likely to take place in December; set to be staged in India
content: IPL 2026 mini-auction is set for December 13-15, with franchises submitting retention lists by November 15. The auction might return to India after overseas editions. Several high-profile players, including Sam Curran and Devon Conway, are reportedly being considered for release. Australian all-rounder Cameron Green is expected to be a major draw.

title: 'Priya Kapur behaving like Cinderella's stepmother': What Karisma's kids told HC
content: In a Delhi High Court inheritance battle, Sunjay Kapur's children from ex-wife Karisma Kapoor accused his current wife, Priya Kapur, of behaving like "Cinderella's stepmother" and usurping assets. They allege Priya presented a forged will to secure a larger share of the Rs 30,000 crore estate, putting the children in danger.

title: Mysterious explosions in Kabul: Did Pak carry out airstrike? Here’s what we know
content: Explosions rocked Kabul late Thursday night, causing panic. This follows an incident where the Pakistani military killed 30 militants. These militants were responsible for the deaths of nine soldiers and two officials in Balochistan. The Pakistani army claims India's involvement in the Balochistan attack. Investigations into the Kabul blasts are ongoing.

title: Another milestone for Bumrah! India seamer joins Dhoni, RoKo in elite list
content: Jasprit Bumrah has achieved a significant milestone. He is now the first Indian fast bowler to participate in 50 matches across all three formats of the game. This achievement follows his recent record as the fastest Indian bowler to claim 50 home Test wickets.

title: Sister Jean’s cause of death: Loyola-Chicago chaplain legend passes at 106
content: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, Loyola University Chicago's cherished chaplain, has passed away at 106. She gained global fame during the 2018 basketball team's Final Four run.  Sister Jean provided spiritual guidance and mentorship for decades. Her legacy extends beyond sports, encompassing a memoir and community programs.  She was a symbol of hope and faith for many.

title: Jodhpur varsity students get 137 out of 100; results withdrawn
content: MBM Engineering University in Jodhpur has withdrawn BE II semester results. Students received marks exceeding the maximum possible in practical and sessional papers. The university cited a technical error by the agency responsible for online result preparation. Corrected results are expected soon. Approximately 800 students appeared for the exam held in May.

title: Buildings shake, lights out: Panicked residents flee as 7.6 quake hits Philippines
content: A powerful magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck off Davao Oriental in the Philippines, causing widespread panic and prompting evacuations due to tsunami threats. Videos depict chaos in hospitals and offices as tremors shook buildings. Authorities are warning of aftershocks and urging coastal residents to move to higher ground.

title: Avalanche hits Himachal's Dharamshala; snow cascades on Dhauladhar Hills - watch video
content: An avalanche struck the snow-covered Dhauladhar Hills in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh, on Friday. The powerful slide was captured on video, with no casualties reported thus far. This event follows heavy rains and snowfall across several districts, and a recent landslide that claimed 18 lives.

title: 'Chopped into 50 pieces': UP governor Anandiben Patel slams live-in relationships
content: Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel cautioned young women against live-in relationships at convocation ceremonies in Varanasi, citing orphanages as an outcome. She urged students to focus on education and national responsibility, warning against drug abuse and emphasizing the purpose of education for life change. Degrees were awarded to over 71,000 students.

title: Circumcision causes autism? Team Trump's new claim on Tylenol use
content: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. courted controversy by asserting an unproven link between infant circumcision, Tylenol use, and autism during a Cabinet meeting. He reiterated discredited theories connecting Tylenol use during pregnancy to autism, despite expert consensus refuting these claims. Kennedy's remarks have renewed concerns about his influence on evidence-based public health policy.

title: Breaking Good – how three scientists created materials that could save the planet
content: So, say hello to the men who turned chemistry from Breaking Bad into Breaking Good. This year’s Nobel Prize in Chemistry is actually pretty easy to get — and no, it doesn’t involve blue crystals or an RV in the desert. The 2025 Nobel went to Richard Robson, Susumu Kitagawa, and Omar Yaghi for inventing something called metal–organic frameworks, or MOFs. If that sounds like chemistry jargon designed to make you feel stupid, relax. MOFs are basically sponges made of metal and carbon, but on a molecular level — invisible, perfect, and outrageously clever.

title: Bengaluru horror: Mother strangles 2 children before killing herself in Bagalagunte
content: A 40-year-old woman tragically killed her two young children, aged four and one, before taking her own life at their Bengaluru residence. Police found the children strangled and the woman hanging. The motive behind this devastating incident remains unknown as investigations are ongoing.

title: Censor board denies certificate to Malayalam film 'Haal' over biryani scene
content: Shane Nigam's upcoming romantic drama 'Haal' faces release delays as the Censor Board suggests 15 changes, including a controversial beef biryani scene. Makers deny the scene's existence and have approached the Kerala High Court challenging the CBFC's decision, which could lead to an 'A' certificate.

title: 'Contrary to ... ': US to sell new air-to-air missiles to Pakistan? Embassy issues clarification
content: The US Embassy in India on Friday debunked reports of supplying new missiles or upgrades to Pakistan, clarifying a recent Department of War (DoW) announcement.  The embassy stated that a contract amendment for sustainment and spares does not involve delivering new Advanced-Medium-Range Air-to-Air Missiles (AMRAAMs) to Islamabad, countering earlier speculation.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for October today?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to dip, with analysts advising traders to sell on any rise. Technical indicators like EMA crossover, Bollinger Bands, and MACD signal strong bearish momentum. Investors should consider selling near ₹1,21,200–₹1,21,500 with targets at ₹1,20,000 and ₹1,19,100.

title: Pakistan: Roads blocked, mobile internet suspended in Islamabad - All you need to know
content: Pakistani authorities have closed major roads and suspended mobile internet services to preempt a protest march by the Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) in Islamabad. The TLP announced the march to protest Gaza killings, prompting a security crackdown including sealing the Red Zone and enforcing Section 144 across Punjab.

content: Joel Embiid has averaged just 50 games played over nine seasons . he's reached 60 games just four times last season . the 76ers are a dominant fantasy player when healthy . here are five big names to avoid in your drafts .

title: At 66, John Calipari is innovating off the court, too
content: a reserve walk-on named Lawson Blake tore an Achilles while working out . calipari took over in the spring of 2024 . he was struck with a thought . "what if we had just given him a million dollars and then he got injured"

title: Isles praise Schaefer after 'really good' NHL debut
content: the 18-year-old becomes the youngest defenseman in NHL history to record a point on his league debut . it's the only time he looked like a rookie all night during the opening faceoff . the top pick in the June draft wasted little time showcasing why the Islanders coveted him .
